snippet: In purchasing TNK-BP, the Russian state-owned oil giant will become the world’s largest publicly traded oil company by output, but that won’t necessarily earn it investors’ respect.
abstract: Rosneft's purchase of TNK-BP, Russian state-owned oil giant, will create world’s largest publicly traded oil company by output; Rosneft is inefficiently managed and, as a government-controlled entity, subject to the vagaries of Kremlin policy, prompting investors to be willing to pay far less for a share of assets than they are for rival oil companies.

byline.original: By STANLEY REED and ANDREW E. KRAMER
byline.contributor: Stanley Reed reported from London and Andrew E. Kramer from Moscow.

lead_paragraph: In purchasing TNK-BP, the Russian state-owned oil giant will become the world’s largest publicly traded oil company by output, but that won’t necessarily earn it investors’ respect.

headline.seo: Russia’s Rosneft Courts Investors in TNK-BP Deal
headline.main: Russia’s Rosneft Courts Investors in TNK-BP Deal
headline.print_headline: With Deal to Acquire TNK-BP, Rosneft Courts Investors Wary of Inefficient Management
